title: Fiddler on the Roof
content:
Can anyone suggest a body font for play bills for a middle school production of Fiddler on the Roof? The show's logo is done by hand (and follows the style of several of the classic Fiddler logos) so I can't just use what the logo designer used.

Thank you very much.

J F F
author: NorthernDancer

comments.content:
A nice allusion to Jewish culture would be to use a font that has horizontal stroke stress, such a FF Balance.  
 [http://ilovetypography.com/2008/06/04/typeface-review-ff-balance/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416050915/http:/ilovetypography.com/2008/06/04/typeface-review-ff-balance/ "http://ilovetypography.com/2008/06/04/typeface-review-ff-balance/")

hhp

Well, the musical is set in 1905 in Tsarist Russia. A period typeface would be good, or something evocative of the period....

Perhaps Jenson Oldstyle (the ATF/LTC typeface)? [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-jenson/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416050915/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-jenson/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-jenson/")
